thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 31 Jan 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Malaysian Jan crude price rises to three-year high

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Malaysian Jan crude price rises to three-year high
text: SINGAPORE, Feb 1 (Reuters) - The official selling price of a basket of January-loading Malaysian crude oil grades OSP/MY has been set at $73.53 a barrel, the highest since January 2015, Reuters calculations showed on Thursday. The January price for flagship Labuan rose $4.99 per barrel from the previous month. Petronas sets the benchmark based on the spot differentials to dated Brent for the four grades - Labuan, Miri, Kikeh and Kimanis. The Malaysian crude benchmark mechanism was launched in January 2014, and updated to include the Kimanis crude grade starting January 2017. Here are the OSPs for the Malaysian grades: PETRONAS 2017 TERM PRICES (INCLUDES "P" ADJUSTMENT) JAN DEC NOV LABUAN 73.53 68.54 67.12 MIRI 73.53 68.54 67.12 KIKEH 73.53 68.54 67.12 KIMANIS 73.53 68.54 67.12 TAPIS 75.13 66.94 65.52 DULANG 73.93 68.14 66.72 BINTULU 75.13 66.94 65.52 (Reporting by Jessica Jaganathan and Florence Tan; Editing by Sunil Nair)
